trips.name: Grand Canyon National Park
trips.description: Vast red rock canyon carved by the Colorado River.
trips.long_description: Stretching 277 miles long and over a mile deep, theGrand Canyon reveals nearly two billion years of Earth's history through itscolorful layers of rock. Visitors can hike, raft, or simply take in thebreathtaking views from the rim, watching the light shift across the canyonwalls throughout the day.

trips.name: Carhenge
trips.description: Stonehenge replica made entirely from vintage cars.
trips.long_description: Located near Alliance, Nebraska, Carhenge recreatesthe famous English monument using 38 old automobiles painted gray and arrangedin the same proportions as the original. It’s a quirky celebration of both artnd Americana that attracts thousands of visitors each year.

trips.name: Joshua Tree National Park
trips.description: Iconic desert park known for its unique Joshua trees.
trips.long_description: Where the Mojave and Colorado deserts meet, JoshuaTree National Park is a land of rugged rock formations and stark desert beauty.Named for its spiky, twisted trees, the park offers world-class climbing,stargazing, and the kind of silence that’s hard to find anywhere else.

trips.name: World’s Largest Ball of Twine
trips.description: A roadside legend in Cawker City, Kansas.
trips.long_description: Started by a single resident in 1953, this enormousball of sisal twine has been growing ever since, thanks to contributions fromlocals and travelers alike. It stands as a living monument to small-town pride,oddity, and community spirit.

trips.name: Mount Rushmore
trips.description: Famous presidential monument carved into granite.
trips.long_description: Sculpted into the Black Hills of South Dakota, MountRushmore features the faces of Washington, Jefferson, Roosevelt, and Lincoln.The monument took 14 years to complete and stands as a tribute to the nation’sfounding, growth, and preservation.

trips.name: Salvation Mountain
trips.description: A technicolor art installation in the desert.
trips.long_description: Created by artist Leonard Knight, Salvation Mountainis a massive, hand-built monument proclaiming love and faith through brightpaint, adobe, and straw. Its kaleidoscope colors and handmade details make itone of California’s most photographed outsider art sites.

trips.name: Antelope Canyon
trips.description: A sandstone slot canyon of swirling colors.
trips.long_description: Carved by centuries of flash flooding, AntelopeCanyon in Arizona is a masterpiece of nature’s sculpting. Light beams filterthrough narrow openings, illuminating the orange and purple waves of sandstone,creating an otherworldly atmosphere beloved by photographers.

trips.name: Cadillac Ranch
trips.description: Ten Cadillacs buried nose-first in the Texas desert.
trips.long_description: A public art installation outside Amarillo, CadillacRanch was created in 1974 by a group called Ant Farm. The half-buried cars spanthe evolution of the Cadillac tailfin, and visitors are encouraged to add theirown spray-painted art, keeping the exhibit ever-changing.

trips.name: Devils Tower
trips.description: Towering volcanic monolith in Wyoming.
trips.long_description: Rising dramatically from the plains of Wyoming,Devils Tower is a striking natural formation revered by Native American tribesand known as the nation’s first national monument. Its fluted columns are afavorite among climbers and photographers alike.

trips.name: Roswell UFO Museum
trips.description: Dive into UFO lore and alien encounters.
trips.long_description: The International UFO Museum in Roswell, New Mexicoexplores the mystery of the alleged 1947 UFO crash. Packed with exhibits,photos, and first-hand accounts, it’s a pilgrimage site for believers,skeptics, and pop-culture enthusiasts alike.

trips.name: Niagara Falls
trips.description: World-famous waterfalls between the US and Canada.
trips.long_description: Niagara Falls’ massive cascades send over 3,000 tonsof water per second tumbling down its cliffs. Visitors can view the spectaclefrom both sides of the border, take a boat into the mist, or marvel atnighttime light shows and fireworks.

trips.name: Bonneville Salt Flats
trips.description: Utah’s surreal expanse of pure white salt.
trips.long_description: A remnant of ancient Lake Bonneville, these vastflats stretch for miles and create a mirror-like effect after rain. They serveas a natural racetrack for land speed records and a photographer’s dream forminimalist landscapes.

trips.name: Crater Lake National Park
trips.description: A deep volcanic lake with brilliant blue water.
trips.long_description: Formed nearly 8,000 years ago by the collapse ofMount Mazama, Oregon’s Crater Lake is the deepest in the United States. Itspristine waters and steep surrounding cliffs make it one of the mostspectacular natural sights in the Pacific Northwest.

trips.name: Mystery Spot
trips.description: Optical illusion attraction in Santa Cruz.
trips.long_description: Since the 1940s, the Mystery Spot has baffledvisitors with tilted rooms and gravity-defying effects. Whether a trick ofperspective or something stranger, it remains one of California’s most enduringroadside curiosities.

trips.name: Sequoia National Park
trips.description: Home of the world’s largest trees.
trips.long_description: California’s Sequoia National Park shelters the giant sequoias — ancient trees that can live over 3,000 years and tower morethan 250 feet high. The General Sherman Tree, the world’s largest by volume,inspires awe in all who stand beneath it.

trips.name: South of the Border
trips.description: Neon roadside landmark along I-95.
trips.long_description: Straddling the North Carolina–South Carolina line,South of the Border has been luring travelers for decades with its colorfulbillboards, giant sombrero tower, and kitschy charm. It’s equal parts nostalgictourist trap and road trip rite of passage.

trips.name: Bryce Canyon National Park
trips.description: Maze of crimson spires called hoodoos.
trips.long_description: Bryce Canyon’s amphitheaters of red and orange rockformations glow vividly at sunrise. Its high-elevation trails weave amongwhimsical pillars carved by frost and erosion, offering one of the most surrealandscapes in the American West.

trips.name: Route 66 Museum
trips.description: Celebrating America’s historic highway.
trips.long_description: Located in Oklahoma, this museum traces the culturallegacy of Route 66 — the ‘Mother Road’ that connected Chicago to Los Angeles.Through vintage cars, neon signs, and personal stories, it captures the romanceof mid-century American travel.

trips.name: Arches National Park
trips.description: Landscape filled with over 2,000 natural arches.
trips.long_description: Arches National Park, in Utah’s red rock country, isa wonderland of delicate sandstone arches, spires, and fins. Sunrise and sunsetturn the formations fiery red, creating unforgettable views and endlessopportunities for exploration.

trips.name: The Wave, Arizona
trips.description: Famous swirling rock formation near the Utah border.
trips.long_description: Hidden within the Paria Canyon–Vermilion CliffsWilderness, The Wave is a geological masterpiece of undulating sandstone. Itssurreal patterns and vivid stripes draw photographers from around the world —though only a handful of daily visitors are permitted via lottery.
